subject: Critical Thinking
title: Primary vs. Secondary vs. Tertiary Sources
description: A short lesson to help you apply Primary vs. Secondary vs. Tertiary Sources.

hook.text: A tweet quotes an article that cites a study. The tweet is wrong. The article is misleading. The study is paywalled.

buildup.text: Primary sources: the original data. Secondary: analysis of primary. Tertiary: summaries of secondary.

discovery.text: Each link in the chain introduces distortion.

twist.text: Most people never reach the primary source.

climax.text: The gold habit: when a claim matters, trace it back to the primary source.

punchline.text: The further from the source, the further from the truth.

quiz.question: Why should you trace claims back to primary sources?
options: Each link in the information chain introduces distortion
